annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: EN
annotations.translation: 英语

annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: Official Journal of the European Union
annotations.translation: 欧盟官方公报

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (21) To ensure the achievement of the targets in good time, Member States should set up specific control programmes, which the Community should approve.
annotations.translation: (21) 为确保及时实现目标，成员国应制定具体的控制方案，并由共同体批准。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (22) The main responsibility for the safety of food should lie with food and feed business operators. Member States should, therefore, encourage the creation of business wide control programmes.
annotations.translation: (22) 食品安全的主要责任应当由食品和饲料经营者承担。因此，成员国应鼓励制定全企业范围的控制方案。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (23) Within their control programmes, Member States and food and feed business operators may wish to use specific control methods. However, certain methods may not be acceptable, in particular if they hamper the achievement of the target in general, interfere specifically with necessary testing systems or give rise to potential threats to public health. Appropriate procedures should therefore be laid down enabling the Community to decide that certain control methods should not be used as part of control programmes.
annotations.translation: (23) 在其控制方案中，成员国以及食品和饲料经营者可能希望使用特定的控制方法。然而，某些方法可能是不可接受的，特别是如果它们总体上妨碍了目标的实现，特别是干扰了必要的测试系统或对公众健康造成潜在威胁。因此，应制定适当的程序，使共同体能够决定某些控制方法不应作为控制方案的一部分。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (24) Control methods may also exist or be developed which, as such, do not fall under any specific Community legislation on product approval but would help to achieve the targets for the reduction of the prevalence of specified zoonoses and zoonotic agents. It should, therefore, be possible to approve the use of such methods at Com munity level.
annotations.translation: (24) 控制方法也可能已经存在或正在开发，因此不属于任何关于共同体产品审批的特定立法范畴，但将有助于实现减少特定人畜共患病和人畜共患病病原体流行的目标。因此，应该可以在共同体层面批准使用此类方法。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (25) It will be essential to ensure that restocking of animals takes place from flocks or herds that have been subject to controls in accordance with the requirements of this Regulation. When a specific control programme is in force, the results of testing should be forwarded to purchasers of animals. To that end, specific requirements should be added to the corresponding Community legislation on intra-Community trade and imports from third countries, in particular as regards consignments of live animals and hatching eggs. Directive 64/432/EEC, Council Directive 72/462/EEC of 12 December 1972 on health and veterinary inspection problems upon importation of bovine animals and swine and fresh meat from third countries (¹) and Council Directive 90/539/EEC of 15 October 1990 on animal health conditions governing intra-Community trade in, and imports from third countries of, poultry and hatching eggs (²) should be amended accordingly.
annotations.translation: (25) 必须确保从根据本条例的要求受到控制的羊群或牛群中补给动物。在实施特定的控制方案时，应将测试结果告知动物购买者。为此，应在共同体内部贸易和从第三国进口的相应共同体立法中增加具体要求，特别是关于活体动物和孵化蛋的托运。应相应修正第 64/432/EEC 号指令、1972 年 12 月 12 日关于从第三国进口牛类动物、猪和鲜肉的健康和兽医检查问题的理事会第 72/462/EEC 号指令  (¹) 以及 1990 年 10 月 15 日关于共同体内部贸易和从第三国进口家禽和孵化蛋的动物健康状况的理事会第90/539/EEC 号指令 (²)。

annotations.label: Footnote
annotations.text: (¹) OJ L 302, 31.12.1972, p. 28. Directive as last amended by Commission Regulation (EC) No 807/2003 (OJ L 122, 16.5.2003, p. 36).
annotations.translation: (¹) OJ L 302，1972 年 12 月 31 日，第 28 页。经委员会 (EC) 第 807/2003 号条例（OJ L 122，2003 年 5 月 16 日，第 36 页）最后修正的指令。

annotations.label: Footnote
annotations.text: (²) OJ L 303, 31.10.1990, p. 6. Directive as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 806/2003.
annotations.translation: (²) OJ L 303，1990 年 10 月 31 日，第 6 页。经 (EC) 第 806/2003 号条例最后修正的指令。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (26) The adoption of this Regulation should not affect the additional guarantees agreed for Finland and Sweden on their accession to the Community and confirmed by Commission Decisions 94/968/EC(³), 95/50/EC(⁴), 95/160/EC(⁵), 95/161/EC(⁶), 95/168/EC(⁷) and by Council Decisions 95/409/EC(⁸), 95/410/EC(⁹) and 95/411/EC(¹⁰). This Regulation should provide a procedure for the granting, for a transitional period, of guarantees to any Member State that has an approved national control programme exceeding the minimum Community requirements in relation to salmonella. The results of tests on live animals and hatching eggs traded with such a Member State should meet the criteria laid down in its national control programme. Future Community legislation on hygiene rules for food of animal origin should provide a similar procedure in respect of meat and table eggs.
annotations.translation: (26)本条例的通过不应影响芬兰和瑞典在加入共同体时商定的并经委员会第 94/968/EC (³)、95/50/EC (⁴)、95/160/EC (⁵)、95/161/EC (⁶)、95/168/EC (⁷) 号决定和理事会 第95/409/EC (⁸)、95/410/EC (⁹)、及95/411/EC (¹⁰) 号决定确认的额外保障。这项条例应规定一个程序，以便在过渡时期内，保证向已批准的国家控制方案超过共同体关于沙门氏菌的最低要求的成员国提供保证。与此类成员国交易的活体物和孵化蛋的检测结果应符合其国家控制方案规定的标准。欧共体今后关于动物源性食品卫生规则的立法应就肉类和食用蛋提供类似的程序。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (27) Third countries exporting to the Community must implement equivalent measures for the control of zoonoses at the same time as measures are applied in the Community.
annotations.translation: (27) 向共同体出口的第三国必须在共同体实施措施的同时也实施控制人畜共患病的同等措施。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (28) As regards control of salmonella, available information tends to show that poultry products are a major source of human salmonellosis. Control measures should, therefore, be applied to production of those products, thus extending the measures initiated under Directive 92/117/EEC. As regards the production of table eggs, it is important to establish specific measures concerning the placing on the market of products originating from flocks that have not been tested free of relevant salmonella. As regards poultry meat, the aim is to place on the market poultry meat with reasonable assurance that it is free from relevant salmonella. transitional period is necessary for food business operators to adapt to the measures envisaged, which may be adapted further in particular in the light of scientific risk assessment.
annotations.translation: (28) 在控制沙门氏菌方面，现有资料倾向于表明，家禽产品是人类沙门氏菌病的主要来源。因此，应对这些产品的生产适用控制措施，从而扩大根据第 92/117/EEC 号指令启动的措施。关于食用蛋的生产，必须制定具体措施，禁止将未经相关沙门氏菌检测的鸡群产品投放市场。关于家禽肉，目标是在合理保证家禽肉不含相关沙门氏菌的情况下投放市场。食品企业经营者需要一个过渡期才能适应所设想的措施，这些措施可以根据科学风险评估作进一步调整。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (29) It is appropriate to designate national and Community reference laboratories to give guidance and assistance on matters falling within the scope of this Regulation.
annotations.translation: (29) 宜指定国家和共同体参考实验室就本条例范围内的事项提供指导和协助。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (30) To ensure the uniform application of this Regulation, provision should be made for the organisation of Community audits and inspections in accordance with other Community legislation in this field.
annotations.translation: (30) 为确保本条例的统一适用，应根据共同体在这一领域的其他立法，为组织共同体审计和检查做出规定。

annotations.label: Footnote
annotations.text: (⁵) OJ L 105 9.5.1995, p. 40. Decision as last amended by Decision 97/278/EC (OJ L 110, 26.4.1997, p. 77).
annotations.translation: (⁵) OJ L 105，1995 年 5 月 9 日，第 40 页。经第 97/278/EC 号决定（OJ L 110，1997 年 4 月 26 日，第 77 页）最后修正的决定。
